title.text: Book Reviews The Humanities Computing Yearbook 1989-90 Ian Lancashire (editor)

entities.text: Book Reviews The Humanities Computing Yearbook 1989-90 Ian Lancashire (editor)

abstractContent.text: This excellent reference book should be on the shelves of all scholars interested in computational approaches to the humanities disciplines.
The international Editorial Board of the Humanities Computing Yearbook (HCY) 1989-90 construes the term "humanities disciplines" broadly; i.e., to include traditional and computational linguistics.

entities.text: international Editorial Board of the Humanities Computing Yearbook (HCY) 1989-90

abstractContent.text: Since the selling price is high, I give extensive details from the table of contents and include the number of pages per topic to assist readers of this review in making a purchasing decision.
The 701-page volume is organized into three unequal parts.
